snippet: The reactors at the Sendai plant would be the first brought back online under new safety standards introduced in the wake of the Fukushima disaster.
abstract: Japan moves closer to reviving part of its nuclear power industry, as regional government agrees to restart two reactors at a plant that is among a dozen nationwide waiting to return to service following 2011 Fukushima disaster.
lead_paragraph: The reactors at the Sendai plant would be the first brought back online under new safety standards introduced in the wake of the Fukushima disaster.

headline.main: Regional Politicians Approve Restart of Nuclear Plant in South of Japan
headline.print_headline: Japan: Regional Officials Agree to Restart 2 Reactors
